description: same as title doesn't work in 2024
Simply doesn't work.
Just a black screen. Nothing works yet
using ubuntu 19.04 , app launches in a black screen
Super glad to see GOG Galaxy on linux! :D
An unexpected news, but a welcome one.
Love GoG, thanks for supporting linux. Works as expected on my Ubuntu release so far

To be honest, if there were a better option, I would most probably demote this rating to four stars. However, this is the best and easiest app I know of by which to play Windows video games, as Wine is a lot harder to get to work, especially when trying to use DRM video games that download files from the Internet by default in order to be even able to play the game. 

Galaxy is a life saver for me as a gamer. I started Linux, fell in love, am never going back to Windows. Ever. Ever. EVER. Many good reasons. 

I can play maybe half of my favorite or top favorite games with Galaxy. Of course, you have to buy the games to play them through Galaxy, via goodoldgames.com, or GoG.com. for short.  Try both if one doesn't work. However, honestly, especially if you are having trouble learning how to not mess up your operating system while tinkering around, the incentive of having saved games in a cloud for many games, is a good one. Also, GoG (Good Old Games) has sales pretty much just constantly, I do believe literally 100% of the time. Spend smart, don't buy things at full price, buy the games you're not sure about when they're on major sales. It's a wonderful app, and, for anyone who is a gamer like me, who depends on video games to unwind, this is a life saver... not far from literally. 

Some games won't run in Linux, even with this app.  But, almost nothing runs with just Wine, at least without major work. 

The app is free, the games aren't, but can be bought at almost nothing when on sale... very highly recommended.
summary: The best and easiest video game app there is for Linux

Black screen on Ubuntu 19.04. Honestly, as much as I think GOG is a gamer friendly company, there are not a Linux Community friendly company. I guess it's expected since the Linux Community itself is gamer unfriendly for the most part - or perhaps gamer apathetic is a more appropriate description - and this in turn affects how video game companies view the perceived cost/benefit analysis to pursue a Linux-based endeavor. The Linux Community MUST be more gamer focused if we want Video Game company to take us more seriously.

As others mentioned it doesn't work. Running the program either by clicking on it or through terminal brings up a black screen at which point your only option is to close the program.
Just being able to play games I had bought years ago on GOG.com again as well as this makes this app essential to this 71 year old gamer.

I have used GOG Galaxy on Windows 10 and runs great! But I hate running Windows 10 on any computer because it is an issue operating system waiting to happen caused by unstable system updates force on users. Not so on Linux systems. Steam client on most Linux distributions runs excellent! I hope GOG takes the same time to fine tune the GOG Galaxy. 

GOG is a favorite site of mine! Download your Linux game. sudo chmod +x the game file which is a game_name_file.sh in a terminal then you can type bash game_name_file.sh and it will install in a GUI giving you install options. Then run the Linux game by cd into the game dir type bash start.sh for most game it 's that simple.

This works for me today (06/04/2021).
I have tried to install GOG galaxy on Linux unsuccessfully for about 7 years. 
It installed successfully with this Wine encapsulation on Linux Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
I am able to see the GOG Galaxy 1.2.66 Home screen (Current version is 2.0.37), Login to my account and filter for games on my account. The Wine VM appears to allow the install of Windows applications with Cloud support to GOG Galaxy. Successfully installed FTL. Cloud Saves Synced. Have not yet tested Update capability. This build seems to be stable. Game crashed at first attempt through GOG Galaxy PLAY button. However, by navigating to the install directory in Wine, the application can be launched by .exe or shortcut. However, this will not sync cloud saves back up to GOG Galaxy server.
summary: Awesome to Finally have GOG Galaxy on Linux
